review.reviewBody: This HH alpha 4.0 jacket is truly fantastic - it does its job so well, that it disappears into the background of your ski day and you can just focus on skiing. The windproofing is great, i sat hunkered down on a chair with a lot of wind and no problem. The main zipper works well, easy to adjust with gloves as you are coming down and generating heat; the venting on the back also helps. Pockets are well placed and sufficient. Only con - After 10 days of skiing i noticed one of the seam threads is coming out - a bit early if you asked me.
review.name: Best ski jacket i ever had

review.reviewBody: I bought large of this HH coat and when I put it on the coat sleeves were very tight against my arms all the way through the forearms even though I was wearing a short sleeve t-shirt. I wear a large t-shirt (6', 205 lbs, 43" chest, 34" waist) and a Sessions XL coat I have is very loose. I went with large on the HH instead of XL so I would have a coat that wasn't so loose on me. I'm sad it didn't work out for me since it is such a sweet coat.
review.name: Great coat but it's like skinny jeans

review.reviewBody:
This is a very nice jacket and quite warm with all the features you could ask for.  However, it is too slim fit for me especially in the arms and I'm not heavy for my size.
I would not be able to wear any layers under it and the arms would still be too tight on me.  Excellent jacket if it fits you. XL would be too big for me.
review.name: Nice Jacket but Slim fit

review.reviewBody: This is a slim jacket that still kept me very warm.  Had to keep on wearing less under it, until I only wore my base layer.  It does fit very snug.  I do think the special insulated pocket kept my phone battery from draining as fast.  Overall, am satisfied.
review.name: Very good jacket - slim fit

review.reviewBody:
Got this for resort skiing in winter ‘23-24. Very happy with this purchase. I had been debating between a technical ski shell or this, very glad I chose this option. The fabric is stretchy, which makes it much more comfortable than a typical shell, and has no associated crinkle with movement. The interior liner is very soft, and I’ve frequently worn just a t shirt underneath in milder (>25 degree) weather comfortably when walking around town.

I skied with it in Vail in a -25 F windchill, was perfectly warm with a heavy baselayer and mid-weight midlayer. Similarly comfortable in heavy wet snow at +30 F with only a light base layer and vents open. 

I had been concerned about the waterproofing material compared to a GoreTex 3L option, but this was a non-issue; Sitting on the chairlift in heavy wet snow my shell pants soaked through, but there wasn’t a spot on this jacket. 

The hood works well over a helmet or without a helmet, though the removable nature makes it flare a little at the cheeks compared to an integrated non-removable option. This isn’t an issue except in sub-zero windchills. Nice to be able to remove it as well.
review.name: Outstanding resort ski jacket / a

name: Alpha 4.0 Jacket - Men's
Helly Hansen Men’s Alpha 4.0 Jacket | GH Review

Buy the Thule HullAPort XTR Kayak & Canoe Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HullAPort XTR Kayak & Canoe Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule HullAPort XTR Kayak & Canoe Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Hull - a - port is easy to install.  Takes a few minutes tops and holds my 10 foot kayak securely to the roof of my crosstrek.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: Very happy with the new updated rack , the strap system used to attach the kayak rack to the load bars is a big upgrade from older models
review.name: Love the new attachment feature

review.reviewBody: Purchased 2 sets of the Hull-a-port for our Wrangler JK. Used the the Jeep brand cross bars and the Thule J hooks fit perfectly. Very easy to put on and take off the cross bars. Our kayaks fit perfectly on the Hulu-a-ports and are very secure. We paid extra for the best and we are not disappointed…would highly recommend and would buy them again.
review.name: Very solid product

review.reviewBody: I have 3 of these carriers. They are solid, sturdy add-ons to my roof rack. One of my kayaks is an unwieldy 72 lb tandem. The design of the rack helps us slide it up on top and into the carrier.
review.name: Great kayak carrier

review.reviewBody: I Bought these racks for a 10 Hour trip to North Carolina. these things are absolutely rock steady. The steel Straps that attach to your cross bars don't slip a millimeter during transit. also the strap guide on the top bar of these racks are great so you can set the strap and fold it up without having to climb up on the car to do so. Very pricey as far as kayak racks go but worth every penny in piece of mind.
review.name: Rock Solid

review.reviewBody: Like another reviewer, I too have problems with the rack sitting flush on the load bars (evo). This results in the hull of the boat only making partial contact with the hull-a-port base pad. I assume these would work much better on the square bars vs evo. On the plus side, the straps are a nice upgrade from previous generation which uses a nut and bot to fasten to load bars.
review.name: Hit and miss
comment:
Thank you for contacting Thule. 
 The Thule Hull-a-Port XTR is designed to sit securely on aerodynamic crossbar shapes like the Thule WingBar Evo. The slope of the vehicle roof it is attached to could affect the overall positioning, but as long as the system is on an approved vehicle, it should be safe to use. 
The kayak will never make 100% contact with the base pad since it is a flat surface holding a rounded boat. It merely provides a cushion and support to keep the boat in place. Once it is secured using the mid-boat straps and bow-and-stern lines, there should be no issues with transporting the kayak.

review.reviewBody: The Hull-a-Port XTR is simple and easy to use.  We've had one for years and recently purchased a second since we now have 2 kayaks.  Thule have improved the two things that bothered me: the attachment to the rail and the clip to hold the tie-down straps.  The new rail attachment uses a strap passing under the rail which works much better than the old pincer mechanism.  On our old Hull-a-Port, the tie down strap would always fall out of the holder at the top of the loop, the new design fixes that problem by narrowing the gap.
review.name: Great Kayak Carrier and Thule Improved it.

review.reviewBody: I’m first feel nervous and worried about new put top with kayak. While i was drive depend Mph 65-70 none problem. They are very smooth and not fall or shake none. There is great the product.
review.name: Thule Hull-a-Port XTR

review.reviewBody: I got this product about a month ago and tested with my 10ft kayak. Overall the product is good but I would add extra support and cushion to the places where the kayak is seated on. You can even see it on the image of the product page. Since the kayak is not straight but has a bit of an oval shape, it is not seated 100% on each of the supports. I am a bit scared that if a get a bump on the road the kayak might crack right open at the spot where its barely touching the rack.
review.name: Rack is good but could be better.

review.reviewBody: I love my new roof rack and kayak rack systems from Thule. Service was good and the product is everything it’s hyped up to be. It was easy to find the right system for my vehicle, easy to order and install. I had a question about my billing and it was answered promptly. What they said would happen happened and all was good. I would definitely recommend dealing with Thule.
review.name: Quality Through and Through

name: HullAPort XTR Kayak & Canoe Carrier

description: Buy the LEKI Makalu Cork Lite Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Makalu Cork Lite Trekking Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Makalu Cork Lite Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these hiking poles. Very good quality and seem to be worth the premiumz
review.name: Good stuff

review.reviewBody:
Very nice poles!  Have used them on some big mile days and the grips are superbly comfortable and I really like the minimalist straps.  The fit/finish is excellent and no slipping from the locking mechanisms so far.
Only issue I can find is that they feel somewhat flexy and do have a slight bit of vibration that you can feel during use as compared to the set of carbon poles I replaced these with.  Minor things overall and they don’t seem to hinder the poles performance in the slightest.
Overall very satisfied and a nice set of poles.
review.name: Makalu cork lite poles

review.reviewBody: I purchased my original Leki Cork Lite poles back in 2015, and they survived an entire thru-hike on the Appalachian Trail. If you need a quality trekking pole, I can highly recommend these after using them for thousands of miles on trail! I love the comfort of the cork handles. To top it off, the customer service at Leki is simply the best.  They recently went above and beyond to help me replace a part on my older poles.
review.name: Love the cork grips - can't go wrong with these poles!

review.reviewBody: Great trekking poles- semi light weight and comfortable grips. Good adjustment mechanisms and lock reliably. With other poles I’m worried about straining too much backpacking weight and bending them, but I took these up Mt Baker and Mt Rainier (w/ opposing ice axe) and they were sturdy supporting 60+ lbs on my back. I wish they packed down a bit shorter (minimum length) for easier travel, but overall they’re great
review.name: Sturdy reliable trekking poles

name: Makalu Cork Lite Trekking Poles

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Folding Bucket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is a must for any boater. It collapses flat for easy storage and when needed for washdown, it pops up and makes a great usable bucket!!
review.name: Folding Bucket

review.reviewBody: I own 5 fabric buckets and sinks but this one is a keeper. Very well built. Although it is self standing, it is much more reliable to hang the filled bucket with the handle do avoid loosing water. There is an extra loop on the bucket to help with pouring. This is always with me when I am backbacking.
review.name: Love this bucket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bucket was indispensable on a recent 12 day float trip through the Grand Canyon. Washing clothes, bathing and hauling water was simplified having this bucket along. Thanks for making a great product!
review.name: This bucket was indispensable on

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this critical piece of equipment. I go ultralight so if something isn’t worth the weight I don’t bring it but we wouldn’t leave home without this little baby. It is light, super durable, and saves so much time and energy going back and forth for water.
review.name: Light weight and super durable water bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this bucket for a Desolation Canyon raft trip, and I was expecting wicked hot temps and silty water. Both were true! This bucket was great to clip by the captain's seat to wash sand and dirt off the boat or have my passenger fill it up and dunk me with it to cool off. Sometimes it was hard to find though, because my friends kept stealing it! Thanks, Sea to Summit :)
review.name: Perfect Little Bucket

review.reviewBody: Bought these for guiding season last year for washing/rinsing dishes and transporting water for cooking. used these on one trip, never again. They were tipping over and dumping the water while sitting on a flat concrete surface! Even when full the water didn't give the buckets stability. Get the kitchen sink instead, a far superior product offered.
review.name: Great idea, if it worked - very disappointing

review.reviewBody: Great bucket, lightweight small to pack and when filled with water min to 30% of total capacity for 10 liter it can stand on its own. It’s not sturdy enough to keep a bottle chilled leaning against the wall but things like cans that can stand on its own works perfectly
review.name: Lightweight lives up to the expectations

review.reviewBody: Bought this in 2012 for a Yellowstone camping trip; campground required grey water be dumped in a specific sink. Last few years have used it with a tiny trailer to capture grey water drained from kitchen sink. Perfect size for capturing a day or two’s water (2 person family) and carrying to proper dumping place (weight of 10l is light enough to not break your back). Note that when empty, it doesn’t stand on its own, but once some water is in it, it will stand. And yes, it does fold down into its pocket again, without too much trouble.
review.name: Compact grey water solution, durable

review.reviewBody: Incredibly light weight yet very robust. Classic sea to summit, this is a must have.

I just returned from a 16 day fly-fishing/raft trip from a back country river in Alaska. Weight of both gear and food for both commercial airlines and bush plane was a primary concern. The Sea and Summit gear that I chose to take fit in nicely with my weigh-in and needs for the trip.

Folding bucket - The folding 10 liter bucket was handier than I thought. We used it for various camp chores and to haul water from the river to put out our fire every morning. Great to have and doesn't weigh but a couple of ounces.
review.name: handier than I thought

name: Folding Bucket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pillow is fantastic! Lightweight and very comfortable... I always bring this pillow with me when I'm out on the trail.
review.name: Wide pillow perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i bought this pillow for my husband, because it was the "tallest" packable pillow for bike camping. He is a big guy, and needs more support... it also reduced his snoring -which i why i bought it.
review.name: sound sleep

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had the pillow for a few years until it developed an overnight leak. Pillow was replaced under waranty.with no issues 5 stars. Will continue.to do business with sea to summet.
review.name: Had the pillow for a

review.reviewBody:
I own five pillows for backpacking, tried to find the one, well this so far is it. At first I didn’t like it a whole lot as its really wide inflated, it seemed unnecessary in wide at first. After using it I see why its so wide because thats one reason its so comfortable. Best if used fully inflated as it adds more than enough height for a side slipper. Your head wont be hanging low. Its so wide the weight of your head is distributed well and it does a great job not feeling like your sleeping on a inflated balloon like some pillows. The “dimples” also do a great job of adding comfort and not adding pressure points laying on it. Its light enough I don’t feel bad as a luxury item in my gear as a pillow of your tenting is so important for good sleep. 
I am exclusively a side sleeper and this is the only pillow that fits the need to make it comfortable.
review.name: Side Sleepers buy this

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pillow. Nice and thick while keeping the weight light and packing up very small. Great addition to my sleep system! I’m a side sleeper so I need a pillow of this height. Nice that is come packaged in a little stuff sack.
review.name: Perfect for side sleepers

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have tried several different backpacking pillows and so far this is the best. Not as light as the Fillo Elite but because it’s larger it doesn’t feel like you’re sleeping on a balloon as some of the others do!!
review.name: Have tried several different backpacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was as I expected, a great size, lightweight, and perfect height for me being a side sleeper.
review.name: All I wanted

review.reviewBody: I love this pillow. Not the lightest but still pretty light and gives plenty of support.
review.name: I love this pillow. Not

review.reviewBody: This pillow is amazing. Has adequate height to properly support your head while side sleeping. The baffle design really makes it feel more soft while maintaining shape. I have been using it as my main pillow at home the last few nights and I am really impressed.
review.name: The only inflatable pillow with enough height for side sleepers

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very helpful addition to Ether Light XT Insulated Air Sleeping Mat: I am 6'6 and have 230 lbs, and this pillow together with the mat gives me the same comfort as my home bed.
Top recommendation!
review.name: Great product

name: Aeros Ultralight Deluxe Pillow

hasVariant.description: Buy the ESI Grips Extra Chunky Mountain Bike Grips online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of the extra chunky grips after trying many other grips. I am 49 and ride my mountain bike on desert terrain trails. My hands start tingling and going numb and being very uncomfortable after about 3 miles of riding. I have tried about 6 different pairs of grips and nothing has helped. These bad boys did the trick! No numbness or discomfort on the 8 rides I have done and up to 12 miles per ride. I will buy these again and again!
review.name: Extra Chunky Grips for the Win!

review.reviewBody:
I've been using these on my bikes for years now. I prefer the Chunky over the Extra Chunky, but for rigid bikes or hardtails the Extra Chunky has a little more cushion. The hand feel is better to me on the regular Chunky version. These are so much more comfy than rubber grips and keep the hands feeling good after a hard day of riding. I have fairly large hands (glove size L) so I can use either thickness comfortably. However if you have smaller hands the Extra Chunky might be too much. 

I get a pretty good amount of life out of these but they do tear easier than some harder rubber grips, especially around the bar end areas. I don't get any throttle after installing these with some rubbing alcohol which can't be said about other brands like Oury. 

The only downside is that riding gloveless if you get sweaty hands these start to become a little slippery after some time on the bike.
review.name: My go to Grips for all my flatbar bikes

review.reviewBody:
I switched to ESI Chunkys on a friend's recommendation after suffering sore forearms for a week from riding the LPS with normal rubber grips.  I haven't used anything else since.  Recently stepped up to the Extra Chunky and love the extra volume.

If you happen to forget your gloves at home, the Chunkys will save your hands.  Good gripiness even with sweat and no blisters.

I've had one or two grips split from falls where the handlebar end hit the ground and a rock must have pierced the grip.  Otherwise, they've been durable and I'll take a grip I have to replace every now and then for the superior grip and comfort.
review.name: Only MTB grip I use

name: Extra Chunky Mountain Bike Grips

review.reviewBody: I've had Guides and G2s on 3 different bikes over the years, most recently these G2 RS brakes that came with a new bike. All the versions have been complete garbage. I do like SRAMs modulation, but these are SO underpowered. I'm not even a big rider - 160 pounds with gear. Pay the little weight penalty and get the far superior Codes, 4-piston Shimano, or any one of the many other better options. Despite how they seem to be specced, these definitely don't belong on a trail bike...I wouldn't even run them on an XC bike.
review.name: Garbage

review.reviewBody:
Coming off Textro 2 piston brakes on a 180mm front rotor. 
THE STOPPING POWER IS INCREDIBLE ON THESE! IM WAY MORE COMFORTABLE FLYING INTO CORNERS NOW! Stoppies are getting better to!

hasVariant.name: Quest Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi Quest Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I found the fit very comfortable—not too tight or too loose. Initially, it felt slightly heavier than some other jerseys I have, but it performed great in low 80s weather. The colors look great, and the branding is minimal, unlike some other brands that put their giant logo everywhere they can. The Dark Spruce/Gulf Teal jersey is sharp-looking. Love the price point - I'll be ordering additional colors. Size L fits me well at 5'10" / 175 lbs. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great Jersey for the price

review.reviewBody:
This new Pearl Izumi Quest short-sleeve jersey has an updated fit compared to the previous (2019) model.  It is now slightly more relaxed (loose) fitting, the material feels slightly thinner, and more noticeably it is also a fair bit longer than the previous model year.  In fact, for me- I now find the Quest jersey to be TOO long.  Taller people might not find issue in the length, but personally I'm pretty disappointed.  The previous Quest jersey was my go-to jersey.  I'm now waffling on whether I'll keep these new ones or if I'll send them back.

This is an unfortunate trend I've seen in Pearl Izumi over the past 2-3 years.  They've taken perfectly good products and tweaked the design-- and in most cases not for the better.  There are exceptions to that (the fit of the new Tour jersey is much better than the previous Tour jersey!), but more often than not things are changing for the worse.  This is coming from someone who has nothing but Pearl Izumi in his gear closet, who is now being forced to look elsewhere for cycling gear because Pearl no longer offers things that fit me like they used to.  

Anyway, I now recommend the new 2022 Tour Jersey over this Quest jersey.  The fit is slightly more snug (standard vs relaxed), but the length is where it should be.
review.name: Longer, thinner, and more relaxed

name: Quest Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: The shorts are comfortable with deep enough pockets for everything, they are stretchier than expected but still look nice. I wish they had a belt loop as well but the draw string works.

review.reviewBody: My current go to shorts, they look pretty nice and the waist band is comfortable, even under a harness or backpack hip belt.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and durable.  I do most things in them from climb to mowing the grass.

review.reviewBody: These shorts fit well when most don't. The material is semi-stretchy, the pockets are perfect sized, and the color is awesome. Half of the waistband is elastic along with a high-quality drawstring in case you need them extra tight. My only complaint is that the mid-seam crotch area is sewn together a little oddly, which might be troublesome to some people. Otherwise, they are amazing.

review.reviewBody: Great shorts so far. I hope the material holds up better than the pant version.

I really like these shorts. I tend to buy “Mens” shorts as I prefer the length. Womens shorts are always too short. The length is great I love the side zip pocket which fits my phone and it works well with my harness.. the material is strong and rugged and holds well to abrasions. I’m 5’5 and 145 lbs and the small fit me great. Im buying more in different colors!
review.name: Great climbing short

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts! They are so versatile, durable and comfortable. I wear them to climb, to work (routesetting), out to bars, to work out, etc. Best shorts ever. Cant' recommend them enough.
I Originally had the notion pants. Wore them for almost every activity for 2 years and decided I needed the shorts for summer activities.  Stretch and thickness is perfect for durability and comfort.
review.name: Best pants/shorts out there

review.reviewBody: Great fit, feel, and pockets, but the material is a bit cozy for a real hot day. Will be busting them out at the shady crags or if they ever crank the A/C at the gym.
review.name: A cool weather short for me

description: Buy the Brooks England C13 Cambium Carved Carbon All-Weather Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: C13 Cambium Carved Carbon All-Weather Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Brooks England C13 Cambium Carved Carbon All-Weather Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: C13 Cambium Carved Carbon All-Weather Saddle
review.reviewBody:
I've completed an 840mile California bike packing trip and a 300 mile 24-hour triple century ride this summer, so I've had some time to think about seats.

I used a B17 Brooks on my California trip - no issues, highly recommended for long trips where you're not a weight weenie.  But on to this seat!

I've used power seats and toupe seats from Specialized.  I like them, but this seat is much more ideal for longer rides (century+).  It feels like a small hammock from your sit bones.  At first, it feels weird, but as my friend told me about Brooks saddles: for the first 100 miles, you'll swear at it, but for every mile after you'll swear by it.

Worth getting if you'd like to try out something a bit easier on your butt for long rides.  Weight-wise, it's heavier, but not crazy heavy with the carbon version.  Just watch out: the carbon rails are squared, so you'll need to make sure your bike works with it.  My Tarmac is fine with it, but my brother's Aeroad needed the metal rail model (round).

Tailwinds! :)
review.name: If you have a sore butt, try this

name: C13 Cambium Carved Carbon All-Weather Saddle

review.reviewBody: They make no noise while walking! Very breathable and super stylish
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Excellent pant!  I purchased these as a wind/rain pant.  The material is very soft and has a lot of stretch.  The fit is flattering as well.  I would definitely purchased these again.  I was so impressed I also purchased an ozonic jacket.
review.name: Excellent product!

review.reviewBody: The length of the Regular size is stated to be 81, in fact it is 76!!! As a result, my pants are short! I don't want the rain to get into my sneakers.
review.name: Incorrect length

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and comfy (for rain pants) but NOT DURABLE AT ALL.  I've only worn these a handful of times and have already had to patch 5+ rips.
review.name: Comfortable, but won't last.

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
- Love the stretchiness of the pants which is great for someone going to be active in them. Very comfy in that regard.
- Quieter than most rain pants. Not as annoying when you walk.

Cons:
- My friend and I both purchased these and after an hour we both had issues with the waterproofing. For waterproof pants, I feel like this is a pretty big issue. My upper quad area on both sides were damp though not fully drenched yet. My friend’s upper quad area on both sides were wet. Therefore I don’t think I can trust these if I’m planning on being in rain longer than an hour. Very disappointing.
- Would like more of a tapered leg or a drawstring for the option to close the pants around my boot and limit any water getting in
- Unsure how something called “full-zip” can stop at the waist but it does. It does not fully zip all the way as I had expected. 

Side note, I’m a bit in between sizes. I wear size 8 or 10 pants and the larges were way too baggy but the mediums are a bit tight around the pelvic/glut region. But they are still very comfy and you can get away with the smaller, less baggy size because of the stretchiness.
review.name: Some great aspects, some not-so-great

review.reviewBody: great fit, waterproof and comfortable. I wear these pants mostly for bike riding if it's cold or raining. They add a layer of warmth over pants, and they're supremely light and waterproof. I got them because they work wiht my Ozonic jacket. My less than perfect rating is because I want the ankle area to be slightly more tapered so that they don't catch on my bike sprocket.
review.name: great fit, waterproof and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Wore these in a typical English rain - light but steady and about 50 degrees. Within an hour, I was soaked to the skin. Everything in my pocket (including my phone) was wet. I cannot express how incredibly disappointed I am in this product or how uncomfortable I was walking for a week in waterproof pants that aren't! Because I didn't wear these for five months after purchase, I am outside the return window.
review.name: Not at all waterproof!

review.reviewBody:
My new pair of Ozonic pant is different from the pairs I have purchased in the past.  I prefer the previous styling to this new one.  The waist is more bulky and 'bunched up' and the side leg zips don't go all the way to the waist, therefore not allowing for a full and easy 'release'.
I also preferred the zip pocket on the upper leg.
review.name: Women's Stretch Ozonic Pant - don't care of the styling of my recent purchase

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are comfortable and very light which is nice when elk hunting up and down the mountains. They certainly are not waterproof. I mean, even wet grass made my socks wet. This is a huge no, no. If Hoka could make these more waterproof, I'd purchase another pair. I would recommend to a friend if they weren't concerned with the waterproofing aspect.
review.name: Comfy but not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoes lasted about 5 months and that's with me buying a pair of Solomons to make up for these junk shoes. Already have holes, maybe wore them discin 25 times max
review.name: Do not buy these, they aren't made for wear and tear.

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I were a size 11,order a size 11.5,they fit like a 10.5.
review.name: Runs very small

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have waited to review - I got these shoes about 10 months ago. My daily step count has almost doubled since I got them - I wear them almost every day. So comfortable and great to stand in all day or walk or light hike. My only complaint is the inside is wearing out intensely and holes have worn into them pretty intensely. They also get a bit wet on the top in any light rain or wet grass. But I still recommend these shoes despite it. Just wish the inside was more durable.
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: For someone who works in law enforcement and who suffers from plantar fasciitis the both pair of Hoka that I bought have turned my everyday pain into something non existent. The recovery and comfort is second to none. I'm on my feet an average of 16 hour shifts and these are life changing.
review.name: Outstanding

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: To be fair these are the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. But I did a 50 mile hike in Peru and the shoes had a hole in them after that. I think that it's shameful to have a shoe that is branded as a hiking shoe and can't even last 50 miles. They need to have a better and more durable design.
review.name: Don't recommend

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I want to wear these in a tactical setting and they are beyond comfortable. Unfortunately the first time I put them on out of the box at home, the bottom lace hook ripped out. I was able to return them to Scheels but they didn't have my size. After reading other reviews with several others having this common issue, I can't justify spending the money for what I can imagine will happen again and again until a new design is produced. Looking forward to se if these reviews help because they are very comfortable.
review.name: I want but can't take the risk

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this for our Mt Rainier trip as a light weight trail shoe until we reached the snow fields and glaciers on our approach then changed to insulated boots. It was a great camp shoe. I hike in these on rocky terrain carrying a 40-50lbs bag and they did great. The GTX worked great while crossing streams and walking on snow around camp. They performed better than I expected. Now I wear them everyday since they provide comfort are light weight and can go off road at a moments notice for unexpected adventures. Anacapa 2 mid GTX performed and over delivered!
review.name: Good for everyday use or backpacking in the mountains!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very nice built very comfortable, the only week point are the shoe laces, coming apart.
review.name: I would buy it again

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I only had these boots for a week and wore them 3 times and the metal top hook popped out while tying the boot. As much as these boots cost the the quality should be much better. The hook shouldn't be popping out after only 3 wears.
review.name: Only had these for a week

name: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: This rope bag is great. It's held up well throughout the climbing season, and is easy to pack, roll, and sling over my shoulder. I like that the tarp is an extension of the bag and has the bag edges on the sides, as it helps keep dirt and rocks off the tarp :)
review.name: Great rope bag

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome rope bag, especially for the price. I've had 2 of them for over 3 years now and have used them heavily for the past 3 years. One carries my gym rope, and the other is used for outdoors. I use them at least weekly and have had no issues with the buckles, as others have reported. I have several other brands of rope bags, but tend to use this one most frequently due to ease of use, functionality and its light weight. Hands down, my favorite rope bag.
review.name: My favorite rope bag

review.reviewBody: Not a bad bag, but the two plastic buckles that hold the bag closed break way too easily.  Go with some type of metal buckle.
review.name: Buckles Break

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for a long time with no issues. It's a little smaller than some of the other rope bags, so I primarily use it as my gym rope bag.
review.name: Good Bag

review.reviewBody: Stores my 80m or 40m rope really well. Can cinch down pretty well for strapping to the top of a crag bag. I'd buy it again.
review.name: Works Great for me

review.reviewBody: Bag buckle broke immediately. Not very comfortable to carry around.
review.name: Broke

hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Circaloft Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight and easy to pack. Not as warm as expected.
review.name: Ok, just not for really cold days.

review.reviewBody:
Purchased these for winter backpacking and as an emergency layer to keep in my touring bag. So far I'm very pleased with them. They conpress incredibly well even though they've got synthetic insulation - which is more ideal than something like the MH Ghost Whisperer pant (down insulation) for winter activities. Between moisture in a tent, contact with snow, sweat from activity, and even from spilling soup/coffee on them - synthetic insulation is much more suited to the task IMO. They're not especially bulky, so they can fit under most standard snow pants (closer-fitting touring pants not so much) and easily over base layers - I don't actually wear them under my snow pants, I run too warm, but would work in an emergency.
For fit rederence: I'm 6'1", 190lbs, 33"waist, 34" inseam and purchased a Med-Reg. Could've gone "Long" length but since I'm usually wearing boots the regular length is more compatible, and won't graze against the ground if I'm rocking camp shoes. Also I've still got very good mobility in them and can handle most any movement other than maybe a super deep squat.
Overall great insulated pant and very happy with them.
review.name: Quality Insulating Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So cozy
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Most incredible pants for using as a mid layer when riding/playing outside, waiting for the bus or walking around town. They slip right over any pair of jeans or khakis, or better yet my North Face sprag pants. They are wind proof and water resistant and I know that they are part of the circular design. Major warmth for the weight and the blue camo color is simply awesome. I get compliments all the time. The pants are soft, cozy snd very warm. TNF outdid themselves with this one.
review.name: Absolute love these pants!! Warm, lightweight and super cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Game changer. My bottom half gets cold just like my top half. Why do I not insulate it!? It feels so wonderful to have warm legs. Great for lounging in a cold house, or to pack along for an outdoor adventure on a cool day. I have no qualms wearing them to the grocery store or such. Light and comfortable. Feels a bit like wearing a trash bag but in the best possible way! I'm skinny and tall and the inseam is long enough. True fit. Would highly recommend
review.name: Warm legs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Outstanding for northern winter walks
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are SO amazing I love them for walks in upstate NY winters
review.name: Great for winter walks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great as overpants for my bike ride to work on cold days! They are also great for lounging, though a little slippery for some surfaces. The cinch doesn't get super tight, points off for that and for only one back pocket.
review.name: Excellent Winter Addition

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fit
review.name: Perfect Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfy, lightweight and really warm. I love these pants and I use to ride around on my scooter in the winter. Wind and waterproof.
review.name: My fav new winter pants

name: Circaloft Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Waist belt attachment points seem to be flimsy. Waterproofing and fabric material are bomb proof.
review.name: Waist belt seems flimsy

review.reviewBody:
This would be a great waterproof pack, except:

I'm 5'6", a muscular 165, and this pack is made for larger bodies. The whole pack rides too low on the body and no available adjustment helps. The shoulder straps themselves are too wide. Pulling the top shoulder strap buckles all the in doesn't do enough to get the pack riding higher.  Although there are loops on either side that the waist band passes through, it's not possible to secure it at the lower point so that the pack will ride higher on my back. With any load in at all, it is bumping on my butt. The trademark seal is fantastic. But, it's not possible to roll the top edge more than once over the seal and then close the securing buckle over it. This also means that you can't take up any slack room in the pack with rolling the seal over a few times. Solid materials and will definitely keep your things dry, but just needs a bit more thought on putting it all together.
review.name: Made for large bodies, design flaws

name: Animas 40L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am 5' 1" and 97 lbs.  I purchased a size XS short.  The pants fit a bit wide around the hips, so it's good that the pants have an adjustable waist. The length works well. The gaiters are a tight fit around the ski boots- the elastic band needs to be at least another inch longer or adding a snap would help.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seems like just enough warmth for those 30-40 degree days.

review.reviewBody: LOVE these pants. After trying many brands (including Patagonia, Mtn. Hardware, Helly Hanson) that simply didn't fit, even in XS - I finally found the perfect fit with Marmot XS! I'm 5', 113 lbs, and althought the pants need to be rolled under for the length to fit - they are perfect in evey other aspect. The material is soft, the burgundy color is beautiful, plentiful pockets, and vent zips are an added bonus to cool off on warm days. Great quality product.
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: These fit me perfectly! I was hesitant when there were only SML sizes and no numbers but I usually wear a 12 and the large were not too large. I like the higher waistband too. Just need some pow to come my way so I can use them!
review.name: I bought these pants and our snow disappeared.

review.reviewBody: These do not have lower legs zippers to easily get the pants around boots. Feet holes seem big enough, but this was a specific feature I was looking for. Also I wouldn’t call these lightweight insulation, seems standard. Fit around the waist wasn’t great for me, too low rise on the back. Otherwise seem like a decent pant.
review.name: Inaccurate Description

review.reviewBody: I am 5’ 8” and weight 150 pounds the pants fit great on me. The waist is lose (I have a 28”waist. I also use an arcade belt but isn’t needed even when climbing they don’t fall down. ) but length is good (30” inseam for me) and everywhere else is a good fit. I have been using them for multipitch climbing but afterwards I have been getting complaints on them.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody:
It’s actually hard to imagine a more poorly designed and constructed product. As a stand alone item, these jeans are terrible; from an ultra low rise (the zip is <5 cm), impossibly skinny fit through the hips and legs, to the shoddy sewing and low quality pocket linings—they’re just really, really bad. 

What adds insult to injury and makes the utter existence of this product not just a disappointment, but actively infuriating, is that they’ve been given the same name, price and list of features as the men’s forged jeans, which ARE actually very well designed and constructed. 

That black diamond considers it okay to suggest that these products are comparable or equivalent tells me how little they value women and afab people as climbers.

The men’s product has a seam allowance for tailoring on the outer leg seam, and reinforced inner leg seams. The women’s product has no seam allowance or reinforcement, only overlocker seams. 

Men get a long fly/rise even by men’s jeans standards, the back pockets are fully lined and *actually* feature an integrated brush pocket, where the “integrated brush pocket” for the women’s product just means “we blocked off a back pocket so now it fits nothing, AND you can’t even fit a brush in the “brush pocket”. 

Even the lining fabric on the front pockets is better quality fabric than the lining on the women’s pockets, and of course men get 5 functional pockets (six if you include the brush pocket). The coin pocket on the men’s jeans is bigger than the front pockets on the women’s product. 

On top of all that, the quality of the workmanship is vastly different between the two, with men getting a well finished product with straight seams, and women getting bunched, wonky seams (and in case anyone is thinking I might have received a faulty product, I ordered two pairs of each for me, my partner and a friend, so I think that’s a decent sample to make a comparison).

That there are supposedly nearly 100 reviews of these jeans that are glowing (whilst nonspecific in detail) makes me HIGHLY skeptical of theses reviews, either these women have VASTLY different expectations from climbing jeans to *literally every afab climber I’ve ever spoken to* or something fishy is going on.
review.name: Shamefully misogynistic bad product

review.reviewBody: They are so beautiful, they fit very well and the fabric looks quality
review.name: I loved these jeans.

review.reviewBody: Seem comfortable and stylish, but run small, had to exchange for a size up.

review.itemreviewed: Heavyweight X Base Layer 1/4-Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the thickness of this first layer, I bought the pants and top! I use them on the cold days. Fit is perfect! and the feel is great
review.name: Great Weight

review.itemreviewed: Heavyweight X Base Layer 1/4-Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my daughter to use for resort skiing. She has used it a few times now and gives it a thumbs up. It has a good fit and is nice and long so it tucks in easily and stays tucked. I was hoping it would actually be a little heavier weight than it is, but on cold days she plans to wear another lightweight layer underneath. I also feel this product is slightly overpriced otherwise I would give it 5 stars.
review.name: Good piece for skiing

review.itemreviewed: Heavyweight X Base Layer 1/4-Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this top! I'm always afraid of being too cold and end up in high loft fleeces that make my jacket fit too tight, but this base layer top is equal parts warm and low-profile. I could see myself using it for way more than just snowboarding. The matching bottoms are super cute too!
review.name: WARM!!!

review.itemreviewed: Heavyweight X Base Layer 1/4-Zip Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this base layer top. It offers a front 1/4 zip that's not too tall, so it doesn't chafe the under chin area.  The fabric is awesome and very comfortable to wear with lay flat seams and a very nice shape that fits my body very well. The shape at the bottom hem is longer in back, providing a bit of extra coverage which I appreciate and will come in handy once ski season begins and this becomes my base layer and needs to stay tucked in!
review.name: Great Fit

name: Heavyweight X Base Layer 1/4-Zip Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: The most lightweight comfortable fabric for warm conditions outside & indoors. Hiking, camping, summer fun, working out, long hospital shifts etc. Super quick dry. Great for travel. I own several & would love to see more blue & teal shades released. Highly recommend :)
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: This shirt fits me well (5'3", 115 lbs). It's very light, perfect for some times of the year. The sleeves were too long, so I hemmed them. I have two of these shirts and they are the first thing I reach for. I may have to order one more.
review.name: Really like these shirts.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable but very thin so you can see through the material. I work in the field and I've already stained it but I think it'll get me through the season. Will be perfect for hot summer days.
review.name: Slightly see through

review.reviewBody: It's great: fit's great, fabric's great, no complaints at all.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Fit is great, love the color.
review.name: Great shirt!

review.reviewBody: Love the echo tops. This is my first because I've been eyeing my husband's for a couple years now. It doesn't disappoint. I do wish there were more color options for women that weren't so see through, the navy I got is great, but don't love many of the other options. A dark forest green, maroon, rust color would be very appreciated. Going to try the Hooded version next! I went with a medium and I'm satisfied. Sometimes I'm a small, but I appreciate the extra room up top. 26" waist, 32DD bust.
review.name: Breezy and Comfy

review.reviewBody: I have five or six of these shirts and wear them all the time. They are cool in the summer and warm in the winter. A nice lightweight shirt. Nice for camping, kayaking, hiking
review.name: Echo long sleeve shirt

review.reviewBody: It is trim fit but fits my body like a glove. I have four of these and wear it for all my summer hikes and travel. Super thin material and breath good. I do wish it comes with thumb holes but it is ok without .
review.name: My top favorite

review.reviewBody: best shirt. good for sun and protection in the summer and as a light base on colder days. Fit is cute too! Ditto to the call for finger holes but otherwise its the bomb XS, 5'5", 112 pounds love the fuchsia
review.name: I wear it daily!

review.reviewBody: I love the Echo line of shirts. Nice and lightweight. Wish the long sleeve tee had thumb holes like the hooded version.
review.name: Great for hot weather

name: Echo Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this shirt…have three different colors of it.
review.name: Perfect shirt

review.reviewBody: Great shirt to keep you cool during outdoor activities and to layer under flannel when working outside.
review.name: Gift for a soccer coach who hates suncreen

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and breathes well in warm weather. Love it.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has become one of my favorite summer shirts. Not having to get slathered up with sun screen is such a great thing. The shirt is soft, breathable, and fits really well. It blocks the sun as advertised and it dries quickly. I bought two because I like it so much. For sizing, I am 6'2" about 178 lbs athletic build and it fits perfect. The shirt is long enough in all areas without being too wide and baggy. I will not run this through the dyer to keep the size as is. Needless to say, I recommend this shirt 100%. You will be happy you went for it! Also, I bought this same shirt but with a hood. I like it so much I wanted a couple with no good just to switch it up. It really is an excellent shirt!
review.name: Soft, breathable, and fits really well!

review.reviewBody: Just purchased at Bass Pro in Daytona Beach.  Not a fan of the fit, at 5’-7” and 190, this large shirt is binding and fits way too tight for my comfort.  The material feels good to the touch in the store, but outdoors it seems to run HOT compared to my other Columbia shirts. Looks good, just not happy with this purchase.  May work better as a base layer in cooler weather.
review.name: Not satisfied

review.reviewBody: Fit, finish, quality, color. ALL GREAT. Will buy more in the future
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: they do not even respond to my email, call, or texts about them not even making the transaction and the item being shipped 0/10
review.name: DO NOT SHOP ON THIS WEBSITE ONLINE BAD

name: PFG Uncharted Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: So happy I purchased these snow boots. They’re super warm and comfortable. They don’t feel to bulky and keep my feet dry. I wear a true 10 and purchased both the 10 and 11 because of the reviews. The 10 was far too snug  I kept the 11 and it fits very well.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great! I've worn them outside in very cold conditions and they've kept my feet warm. Also they're a very light shoe, one thing that I dislike is when a winter boot is heavy as you are walking through already heavy and deep snow - but these boots are surprisingly light. Well worth the purchase.
review.name: Great Boots !!

review.reviewBody: They are super comfy and stylish! What I love most about these boots is you can still go out in the snow looking cute!
review.name: Best winter boots

review.reviewBody: Love this boot so much I look forward to buying it in multiple colors! I like in Canada where the winters are harsh and these keep my feet warm, stop me from slipping and look cute!!
review.name: I will definitely buy again in different colors!

review.reviewBody: Boots are beautiful. They are true to size. I bought them because I am going to Europe in January. They feel super warm and cozy and they are sturdy. I also own a second pair I bought many years ago and I use them when I go to big bear and they do the job. They keep my feet warm, dry and cozy. I love my uggs.
review.name: I would buy again and again

review.reviewBody: Contemplated sizing up in these because they were snug at first. Took them on a walk and by the end they loosened up. The shearling will pack down over time. (I wear thick socks too) I also live in CO and these have kept my feet very warm & dry. Would buy again. I love the mustard seed color.
review.name: Stay True To Size!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and very warm and waterproof. Went hiking and ice fishing in far north and boots kept me warm and dry. Excellent boots would recommend and buy again.
review.name: Very satisfied with these boots

review.reviewBody: I'm normally a size 11 and had hopes these would run true to size unlike a lot of other women's winter boots but they were too small. I wish they made a size 12 as that probably would have been perfect.
review.name: Largest size too small

review.reviewBody: These boots are awesome!!! I bought them to wear in Alaska and I live in LA so I didn't have any winter boots. I haven't worn them in the snow or rain yet, so I cannot attest to the waterproofing. Other reviewers aid the waterproofing is good. I tried on 4 different types of boots (these UGGs, Sorels, Merrells and some others I can't remember and the Uggs were without doubt the most comfortable for me and the cutest. My usual UGG size is 7 and it took me three tries to get to the size 8s that I needed. My feet are somewhat narrow, but I don't think the boots are especially narrow although they do fit my feet very well The Sorels were very big in the toe box and heavy. The Uggs are just right.I am wearing them with a pretty thick Smartwool hiking sock, which will make them even warmer. They were comfortable right out of the box. I strongly recommend!!!
review.name: Awesome boots!

review.reviewBody: I wear my black boots during the winter months in Dublin, Ohio.
review.name: I love my new boots.

name: Adirondack III Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a layer for skiing with a Gortex shell. I returned the jacket. The lack of elastic in the cuffs and no chest pocket were deal breakers for me
review.name: Didn’t like the cuffs or lack of pockets

review.reviewBody: Extremely lightweight, and warm. It’s a really tight fit with only a t-shirt underneath. Go a full size up from what you normally get, esp if you plan on some layering.
review.name: Go a size up if you plan on having anything underneath

review.reviewBody:
This is my second Ghost Whisperer jacket. My first one is about six years old and is still in great shape, save for a couple places where the stitching is coming undone (I might talk to warranty about that...). I also have a StretchDown jacket, but I prefer the Ghost Whisperer, as it provides better protection against the wind. I can layer the Ghost Whisperer with a light merino wool sweater and be plenty warm in temperatures well below freezing.

It's also perfect for traveling since it's so light and warm. I love that I can stuff it into its own pocket and use it as a pillow on the airplane. It was a no-brainer to take it with on a three week trip to Ireland and France in the early shoulder season. I would buy again in a heartbeat.
review.name: None better for the weight

review.reviewBody: This thing is such a great jacket to bring along when it might get chilly. Light enough to pack it and forget it until you need it. Looks good if you want to wear it to the biergarten too. Great for using as a layer under a shell and cool colors. I've got a few now.
review.name: A versatile tool for your pack.

review.reviewBody: I have used the Ghost Whisper Jacket for about 2 years underneath a different coat  which is The North Face Summit 3  The coat fits me a little snug  with a  shirt over  a  T shirt but it works fine with just a t shirt which has held up with 2 years of use fine.   I get Cold easily and do not walk fast due to diabetic neuropathy.  Mainly the use of jacket is for around town or if a building is too cold.  On hikes  just today I used it underneath the North Face Summit 3 when it was 55 degrees along with a T shirt since I stand a lot when I am on hikes. . I had no problems with snugness  Some of the time I just stood and looked at nature which would make a person more sensitive to cold. Concerning the Mountain Hardware 2 series I cannot make a comparison.  Overall the Mountain Hardware  Ghost Whisper Jacket has worked fine underneath my North Face size small jacket.  Since I am a a size small person  the Mountain Hardware Ghost Jacket is a size small.  I am five foot 7 inches and weigh 170 to 175 pounds.  I highly recommend the Mountain Hardware Ghost 2 series Jacket.
review.name: Men's Whisper Jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket is warm and very light. It's great to throw on when the room is cold or to wear outside. I run hot so this jacket really captures the heat and can keep me warm. Definitely a nice buy. If you're broader in the shoulders the size may be a bit small.
review.name: Light and comfortable jacket

review.reviewBody: This coat is lightweight but very warm. I
review.name: Love this coat

review.reviewBody: I'm a big guy, 6'1', 240 lbs. XL is normal size for me, and XL of the Ghost Whisperer fit perfect. I mainly am looking to use it as a mid-layer under a shell for alpine skiing in Maine where temps are very cold and wind whips you. So the fit is important--not too snug given my size, but you don't want a lot of extra bulk under the shell--this worked perfectly. (My wife says its looks good on me so an option as an outer layer off the slopes or for spring skiing.) Has kept me warm with the shell in temps in the teens and wind at 25 mph. The only addition that would be great is a chest pocket for cell phone--I have one in my shell but for really cold days, getting the cell phone more insulation would be great for battery life.
review.name: Perfect fit, and great temperature regulation

review.reviewBody:
Needed a super lightweight yet warm layer to add to my search and rescue pack; the Ghost Whisperer/2 fits my needs perfectly. 

It's so light you'd think it won't keep you warm, but it does, and despite its lightweight it's durable and survives working around sharp granite rocks, trees, bushes, etc.
review.name: Light, durable and warm

review.reviewBody: This is a real fine jacket. It fit perfect, I normally wear in-between a large and extra large, and the large fit perfect. It is finely made, that's for sure. If your looking for a great down jacket, made by a great jacket making company, the Ghost Whisperer is for you.
review.name: Perfect! Buy One, don't hesitate!!!

name: Ghost Whisperer Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Descendant Carbon Eagle DUB Crankset - Boost - Bike Build
review.reviewBody:
I got this crankset on a Yeti SB5 build from backcountry about10 months ago. Due to an injury the bike has seen only  light use about 150 miles total. I'm a fast rider, but not abusive. Not hucking 5 foot drops or anything.

Just got back from a ride where, 6 miles in my pedal started to feel floppy. I thought maybe the sole was coming off my shoe. When I stopped, my pedal literally pulled right out of the threads. I've never seen this happen before, it seems that the threads on the crank are softer than the threads on my pedals. Bad bad bad. Had a long walk to get back to the car.

We'll see if BC will provide a replacement, but I was definitely disappointed with the failure mode. Most of my other bikes have had Shimano XT or XTR, and I've never seen this type of failure with those.
review.name: Threads stripped, crank ruined.
comment:
Sam,

Just had the issue on my Nomad I got not even a month ago. Haven?t put her through the ringer yet at all, but nicked a rock with my pedal causing it to become cross threaded. Now I can?t even get the pedal off... did you have any luck with BC? I?m contacting them now.

Sam,

Just had the issue on my Nomad I got not even a month ago. Haven?t put her through the ringer yet at all, but nicked a rock with my pedal causing it to become cross threaded. Now I can?t even get the pedal off... did you have any luck with BC? I?m contacting them now.

name: Descendant Carbon Eagle DUB Crankset - Boost - Bike Build

review.reviewBody:
I struggled and struggled to install this, only to eventually learn that these chainrings are NOT compatible with XTR 12 speed HG+ chains. I presume they're not compatible with any of Shimano's 12 speed HG+ chains. 

Backcountry, please update your information on these rings to warn customers and please get your hands on Shimano HG+ chainrings.

comment: If you don't even know how to figure out chainring compatibility before you order it you probably shouldn't be installing it yourself. In general, anything 12 speed has limited compatibility in the current market and generally is identified as "12 speed". This is called user error.

review.reviewBody: Love the helmet
review.name: Excelente product

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet about a month ago and i love it, fits perfectly!!
review.name: Great helmet !!

review.reviewBody: I’m not a big fan of MIPS. Yeah, I know, it’s designed to protect your brain better, but the plastic liner is the pits. So, when I stumbled upon this helmet with the new KinetiCore tech, I decided to give it a try. This is a cool helmet for the money. The padding and scrolling retention system are top notch. It’s not as stealthy as some of the higher priced helmets, but it looks good. For me, the fit is perfect; I wear a large and I have plenty of room for adjustment. The chin strap could use some refinement, but it’s simple enough to figure out as is and does the job. Well done Lazer.
review.name: No more Mips

review.reviewBody: Style is personal, this one looks nice to me, except the color, I wanted red, but Lazer's red is more of a burgundy to deep red fade. That said, fit can be done with fine adjustments and you can dial it in for comfort.
review.name: Good value, comfortable fit, nice style

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable helmet that looks sharp on the road. I've not crashed it yet but i've own other Lazer helmets and I'm confident in the safety of this helmet. It holds sunglasses very well which is a crucial feature. The retention system is unique and works better than I had expected. I would recommend this helmet for anyone looking at lids in this price range.
review.name: great helmet that doesn't break the bank

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love the new Scroll adjust system! 
It is so easy to reach the back of the helmet to micro-adjust to the perfect fit even while you have it on. The adjuster is like a grippy rubber belt on the back of the helmet. Super easy to slide. Long hair - no worry. It is super comfortable with a ponytail.
Helmet is incredibly well ventilated with large holes - a must when riding in the summer heat in the south. Air passes through nicely and it feels very light on the head.
I feel confident with new Kineticore protection system and I read that it uses less plastic which I am super happy about! 
Fits true to size - I got my standard medium and there is a lot of room for size adjustment.
review.name: Comfort and fit!

review.reviewBody:
I've ridden with Giro and Bell helmets for over 20 years.  I loved them and never saw a reason to change.  But then I heard about Kineticore.  You see, I have cracked three of those Giro/Bell helmets due to crashing.  Once I was hit by a car, once I cracked some ribs in a crit and once I slid out on a slick patch.  There worst was when I slid out, I whacked my head HARD!  Probably had a concussion but never got it checked.  Anyway, always replaced each helmet with the same version.  But when I read about kineticore and how it is better with real world crashes with rotational movement, I figured I'd try it.  My current Bell is perfectly fine, no cracks but at my age I am starting to think about my long term health as I am not "invincible" like I was in my 20s.

So far I have not tested how well this helmet holds up in a crash and to be honest, I hope I never do.  But if so, I am confident I am protected better than any other helmet I've used.  The helmet looks cool while wearing (which not all do) and is comfy.  I wear a medium and I'd say this fits ever so slightly tighter than Giro/Bell mediums.  I wouldn't size up, it's not that much tighter but if you are already a little tight with a Giro or Bell, you might want to try size up.
review.name: New tech is really cool

name: Strada Kineticore Helmet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this thing! Having the big pocket in the front is so convenient. It has all the features of a jacket without the overly technical look for a casual day at the resort. I am someone with fuller hips and it is definitely more straight cut, even though it is quite loose in my bust / shoulders I ended up wearing it with the side/hip zipper open a bit to give my hips more room to move. Overall love the look and functionality, the lack of ski/board clothes that are shaped for women is pretty much universal, not an issue that's specific to 686.

review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I like this stove. Great simmer setting and a very high flame setting. This is the second stove, the first was returned. The stove was damaged from the factory.  The gas connector is tied inside to the grill rack with a bread tie. Something was stacked on top at either FedEx or backcountry.com. there was a large noticeable dent in the middle of the thin stainless steel plate that surrounds the burners. I sent pictures to backcountry.com and they gladly replaced it with the ladt one they had in stock. They even paid to have damaged one sent back by fedex. When i received the second stove it had the same problem. I emailed immediately and sent pictures. I knew that was the last one in stock so I knew i could not get another. I told them I would keep it but I would appreciate some type of monetary refund. I would have been happy with 10% courtesy discount. I never heard a word. Still haven't got a response. So i just tucked it up and used the stove. Owe the Striker has never worked. I have to light it with a cigarette lighter.
review.name: Do you really want my review?
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We are so very sorry for the shipping issues, we've emailed you to see if we can help resolve this!

name: Selkirk 460 Camp Stove

review.reviewBody: Been loving this shoe! I’ve been climbing for a year and a half now (gym only) and have used a couple different shoes. The first shoe I had was the La Sportiva Tarantulace. Great shoe for me as I was starting. Had some slippers after that didn’t hit the mark and then I got these. This shoe is great. It’s a touch more aggressive than its laced cousin, the Tarantulace. I also bought a half size smaller than the laced version as well. I went with a half size under my street size 11.5 US. Would highly recommend this shoe for someone looking for their second pair of climbing shoes. The rubber is great, very sticky. All around happy with my purchase :)
review.name: Great beginner/intermediate shoe

review.reviewBody: The heel cups are huge and the shoe lacks security in smearing, juggy bouldering and any techincal aspect outdoors. Maybe a gym shoe at best.
review.name: Not bueno

review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of climbing shoes. I have been renting shoes for indoor bouldering for a few months now. I was instantly more successful on the wall when I put these on. Their construction seems really solid and I feel like I will buy the same pair again when these get worn out. I like the extra rubber on the toe and I feel secure in these. I usually wear size 9 and sometimes 9.5 for street shoes. Sometimes 9's are too small.. I got these in 40.5 and the fit is tight and perfect. Toes are perfectly crammed without them being uncomfortable. I originally bought 41.5's but those had a little too much wiggle room at the toes, so I exchanged them.
review.name: Great shoes

name: Tarantula Boulder Climbing Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Eldo Mid GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these a few weeks ago and so far so good!! Very comfortable while hiking! I like that they stay snug when you first lace them up, unlike others that are more difficult to pull tight! The only downside that I see so far is that the laces are way way way too long! Haven’t tested the waterproofness yet so I can’t comment on that, but with the wintry sloppy Ohio weather coming I’m sure I’ll put it to the test! I would recommend these! I wear a 9 shoe and purchased the size 9 boots and they’re pretty much true to size, no need to go up or down in size! Hope this helps!!
review.name: So far so good!!!

review.itemreviewed: Eldo Mid GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Backpacking with trail runners never worked for me. I like a little off trail usually and my feet always got hammered and blistered. 

The Asolo Eldo Mids are just enough additional support to work for me. They only weigh a few ounces more than a pair of trail runners. They are shaped with a long enough toebix that I don’t bash my toes on long downhills. 

So far I’ve done several day hikes, a backpacking trip with a bit of boulder hopping and a 65mi section of the PCT in Washington state. They are holding up well.
review.name: Great step up from trail shoes

review.itemreviewed: Eldo Mid GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased these hiking boots a month ago and have used them multiple times on day hikes on a well maintained moderately steep trail which has several segments with uneven ledge surfaces.  While these boots are light weight, I feel that rigidity of the sole and ankle support were significantly compromised.

I wish I could return these boots as I am completely disappointed with them.
review.name: TERRIBLE HIKING BOOT

name: Eldo Mid GV Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: The firm stiffed and mislead original buyers.Very few backers received tables they purchased or refunds. Process took over 2 years, so credit refunds were no longer allowed. Then sold tables to firms like Backcountry, refusing to deliver to original buyers. If you need service, there will be none. Further Space Innovation blocked honest reviews on IG, FB and other platforms. Backcountry knows this and should disclose these details in the description.
review.name: Producer is bankrupt - do not buy

review.reviewBody: Great quality, fit and finish
review.name: Classic Red Wing

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots a little over a year ago.  I was pretty excited because my first pair of Red Wings, Iron Rangers, I've had for probably close to 15 years and they are still going strong.  Those were the boots that turned me on to the brand and I've loved them.  I was pumped to get Mocs and try a different style.  I bought these in store and was measured for them.  I knew there would be a break in period.  But a year later these boots fit pretty poorly.  The heel slip on both feet is still happening.  I still have to use moleskin to have them be comfortable.  Also have to have cushion inserts.  And while I can wiggle my toes in the toe box, the boot on my right foot doesn't have enough give and a year later is still pinching onto my little toe.  The sizing has turned out to be very poor.  Its disappointing because the boots are well made.  They look good when on.  They are just incredibly uncomfortable to the point where I'm questioning if I'll ever get another pair of Red Wings.  And for the price, to just walk away from them is a tough pill to swallow.
review.name: Not a positive, second purchase experience
comment: Thank you for your honest review. We are sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots. We will be reaching out to you directly to assist you!

review.reviewBody: Great look and feel. Very high quality. The sole might not be what you expect. THey are rock hard to walk in. If you have a narrow foot these will not work at all for you. I ended up returning them and going with the Traction Tread Lite #1221. Night and day difference in comfort, fit my narrow foot, and look very similar. They arnt made in the USA which didnt realize and would. I would have paid more for that.
review.name: Great looking boot but...

review.reviewBody: I dunno.. I bought these about a month ago and I really want to love these boots. I know they take some getting used to along with some TLC. Personally, I like them more with wear than I do brand new and I know that takes some time, so I’m working them in but man it’s taxing. I bought these in store after getting measured and the overall fit feels right but I can’t wear them for more than an hour or two without getting blisters. They’re improving (slowly) over time but the notion that these should be ready to go for the price does cross my mind often. Today (less than 1-month in) one of the laces broke, which seems a bit soon for quality boots and of course I can’t find the laces anywhere; this is somewhat frustrating. I’ll keep working on these, but I hope some relief is in sight, the boots look great.
review.name: Struggling
comment: Hi! I am sorry the break in period has been rough. I will reach out to you directly regarding the laces and to see if there's anything I can do to help.

review.reviewBody: After unboxing, I was wearing these boots at home to break them in. When I took them off I noticed there was a gap, pushed it a little bit and turned out that leather is not glued properly to the mid-sole. I think that it is unacceptable to ship these kind of product to the customer.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I apologize for the issue you’ve experienced with the boots. This is certainly not the standard we aim for, and I will be reaching out to you directly to address the situation and make things right. We appreciate your feedback and are committed to resolving this promptly.

review.reviewBody: love this new color. having a bit of a problem with the right side. it doesn’t seem to be breaking in as well as previous pairs and is a bit uncomfortable. I’m hoping continued use will eventually help.
review.name: my 3rd pair!

review.reviewBody: The leather smells of quality.  The style is second to none and they just look good.  However, there's a break in period but for me it took several months to conform to my legs.  I recommend wearing quality socks above the ankle.  I plan to keep these for a long time...may have to have them resole in a year or two
review.name: Great Looking Boots
comment: Thank you for this good review! I apologize the break in period was rough but I am so glad they are working well for you!

review.reviewBody: I have owned most of Red Wing's heritage boots.  I honestly believe that the 1907 is their best.  Note that the 1907 is made on a different, roomier last than the other moc toe boots in the heritage line.  Toe box offers more room without looking goofy.  Also, the included leather insoles make a huge difference in comfort.  I can wear these all day.   The copper leather makes a nice patina with wear.  Just an all-around better boot than even the 875 (which is excellent in itself).  I would love to see them offer this boot (on the 55 last) in a few more colors.
review.name: Red Wing's Best Boot
comment: This is so great to hear! I am so glad you have found comfort in these. Let us know if we can assist further!

review.reviewBody: I’ve have these boots for over a month.  Fit pretty good at first, but took about 3 weeks to fully break in.  They are now broken in and fit perfect.  The quality of the boot is second to none.
review.name: Great Fit
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I struggled to choose between a size 12 and 13 since we lose the half sizes as big boys. I wear a size 14 Air Force 1, size 13 Timberland Premium, but a 12 Cole Haan loafer, just for reference. I bought the Moc Toes in size 13 and they felt like boats, bought the 12's and my big toe touched, but felt much snugger. Yet I worked a full week roofing in my dads size 11.5 down in FL with the insoles removed and it wasnt bad. I figured insoles are the answer, and my final conclusion is, size up if you are in between, and get a pair of leather insoles like the timberland premium ones or Ugg even makes a nice set. Easier than trying to get thinner insoles of any quality or stretching the toe out lengthwise. The only issue is now I go from 6'5 barefoot to 6'6.5 with the boots and have to duck more often.
review.name: Size 12 vs 13 Help
