review.reviewBody: When I need boots for a hike instead of trail runners, these couldn’t be better. I wear when I need ankle support, need waterproof, or something more heavy duty. They are extremely comfortable and supportive. I’ve had for 4 years and they’ve been through mud, snow, etc - and still wear and look great.
review.name: Perfect hiking boots

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! My foot is wide across the ball area and I have a hard time finding shoes and boots that don't pinch. When I tried these on the first time, they were slightly tight across that area of my foot but soon loosened just enough that they were very comfortable. I wore them in the house for a few days before hiking at South Mountains State Park in North Carolina. We traversed the rocky wet areas of the river and also the trail to the upper falls area which was quite steep. I wore these with the Darn Tough Hiker Boot Cushion socks and they were so comfortable and I didn't have any rubbing at all. I accidentally misstepped on the rocks in the river and my foot slid in about halfway. I was really thankful that the water just beaded off the boot and my foot stayed dry! I did find them to be slippery on the wetter, mossy rocks, but that's not really surprising. They are comfortable, look fantastic, and fit my wide foot, so I am super pleased with them! I went with my normal size of 7.5 and am happy with the fit.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: Got these winter of 2020 and was obsessed with them until recently. They were so comfortable and supportive for about eight months, but recently they?ve started giving me blisters even on moderate hikes. Pretty bumped they didn?t last longer.
review.name: Amazing but didn?t last

review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of Danner boots and I love them.  They are light-weight, comfortable, super cute on the trails and stylish enough to do your urban errands.  As far as sizing, they do not run big.  If anything, they are true to size or small.  I usually wear an 9.5 or 10.  I bought these in 10 so that I could wear thicker socks if I wanted and I am glad I did.   I purchased the Brown/Red and the Java/Bossa Nova colors.  They also each come with two pair of shoe laces so you can mix up the look.  I love  that they are waterproof as there is nothing more uncomfortable than wet feet when you are hiking on a cold day.  The insoles are easy to remove to dry or replace with an orthotic.  If you are going to use a thick orthotic, you may want to size up a half size.  I highly recommend these boots.
review.name: Love these boots
comment: I can?t decide on color. Fraid of the light one showing dirt. My current brown. Probly will play it safe.

review.reviewBody: I bought a 7.5 my regular shoe size.  I hesitated as I get 8 in running sneakers.  These fit fine enough room in toe box and good support cushion in shoe bed.  I got the brown suede and although I have not hiked in them they are hefty enough to go in snow and woodland hiking.  Very pleased with this brand bought the inquire chukka style as well like walking on a cloud.  Recommend
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I read the reviews and most said this boot either ran big or true to size so I ordered my normal size 8.5. Looks like I need a 9 but they can?t return right now cuz of covid so that?s really the only reason for 3 stars. Expensive boot I cant wear and cant even exchange. Really inconvenient to order online with backcountry right now.

review.reviewBody: The Torrent Jersey sits skin-tight, thanks to the grip of the elastic hem, while enabling unrestrictive range of motion. Combined with the drop-tail, the lower back remains well-protected even in racing position. The extended back portion features three deep pouches with ample space for snacks and smaller pieces of garment. Access whilst riding is easy and the strong stretch material offers safe storage. A zipped pocket to the right is large enough to hold valuables like keys and cards that are not required during the ride. The front zip is not only functional, sliding up and down very smoothly, but is also quite stylish with the GORE logo coming on display as the slider travels up.
review.name: Light and functional

description: Buy the Mammut Trion Spine 50L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trion Spine 50L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Trion Spine 50L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great pack. Have used for ski tours and alpine climbing expeditions over multiple nights. I wish it had diagonal ski carry but the A frame works great.

compre esta mochila para expediciones en la nieve, muy bueno el sistema de espalda, pero me falto el cierre para el acceso posterior y también un bolsillo extra para los elementos de seguridad de avalancha. pala, zonda y arva

I went on a backpacking trip to Havasupai, AZ this last June and I spent months researching the best backpack for the trip before landing on this one. The quality of the build, the streamlined functionality, and the overall function of the backpack blew me away. It was everything I needed for a successful backpacking trip and more. The waterproofed exterior came in handy as we faced multiple downpours during the trip, and the available adjustment points allowed me to adjust the pack to the perfect height as well as distribute the pack load evenly on my back. I couldn't recommend this pack enough.
review.name: Best Backpacking Setup

review.reviewBody:
The pack takes abit of adjustment to get familiar with, the way the hipbelt moves is quite different to most packs. 
Carries weight quite well but is a poor choice for those fast and light days as the pack is quite heavy by itself. 
The front opening compartment is great for getting to all your gear without repacking

More of a nuisance than and issue, but the way the active spine system pivots tends to create a super annoying squeak with each step. Will try getting a dry lubricant into the moving parts which should hopefully stop it. Not very often you have to lubricate your backpack

The 50L is great if you need to pack mountaineering gear or a multi-day tour. I got it for medium-long touring days and it's a bit much for average weather conditions but will say it's been clutch on some gnarly storm days where you want to go prepared for a full day. One thing I'd say is the weight distribution is incredible. Took it fully loaded in the Chic Chocs and didn't feel that much heavier than a 30L on the way up, minimally affected the ride on the way down. Like everything from MAMMUT it's just a really well made product and very thought through.
review.name: Great storage and weight distribution

review.reviewBody: Great summer hiker, although it could use some small storage compartments on the inside.
review.name: Great summer hiker

review.reviewBody:
I've used this pack for weekend overnighters, ski touring (including a four day hut trip), mountaineering, and scrambling. I am very happy with the functionality of the pack. However, I have two main complaints:
1. The spine mechanism is very noisy - depending on how full the pack is it will squeak with every step.
2. The Velcro in the Ice tool carry system is terrible.

Otherwise, the pack is well built. The Spine system works well for active sports.
review.name: Great Pack with a couple weaknesses

review.reviewBody: The Trion Spine 50 is exactly what i was looking for. Not the kind of pack with endless pockets and molly but just a nice large space that can carry more than I need for camping or a long hike. It allows enough room for my things as well as my full size DJI Mavik Pro some spare batteries, controller ipad mini and go pro in small pelican case.  The zippers are quality and the fabric has a very durable feel and still looks as good as the day I bought it.
review.name: Overall Excellent Pack

review.reviewBody: Amazing bag with tons of room to pack away gear or bring that extra warm layer when out ski touring. A few more organizing pockets or an actual dedicated avalanche gear pocket (with sheaths/organizing fabric for probe and shovel) would make this bag amazing. The inside fabric is also a bit weak, while trying find a good place for my Shovel blade I put it in a spot that wore a hole through after a fairly short walk. Otherwise backpack is great keeps the weight on your hips and you hardly notice it on your back. Bag also packs down quite nicely when you have less gear and never has felt cumbersome while skiing.
review.name: Mammut Trion spine 50

review.reviewBody:
Got this pack for PNW mountaineering and splitboarding.

Good:

It's a durable, well-made pack with great aesthetics. It has a lot of internal space and good attachment points for skis, axe, poles, and other mountaineering accessories.

Bad:

This pack is HEAVY.

I'm not sold on the active spine system. It's not enough of an improvement over a normal pack to justify the added weight and cost. The spine prevents the pack from having back panel zipper access to the main compartment. You still get zipper access on the outside of the pack but it's difficult to access when your pack is loaded up with an axe, skis and poles.

The other issue with this pack is a lack of external pockets. The "phone" pocket on the shoulder strap can't fit any phone that currently exists. The hip belt pocket is too small. There are no side pockets at all, which isn't a huge deal for cold-weather alpine use but it severely limits the versatility of the pack.

If I were buying again I'd save the money and weight and go with the non-spine version.
review.name: Mixed bag.

name: Trion Spine 50L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I drive a truck and bought these for my duffel bag. They are great. Easy to clean and they don’t rust. Highly recommended
review.name: Great utensils

review.reviewBody: I bought the fork spoon combination with the carrying case it's pretty good for everyday carry if you don't want to use  plastic items from takeout restaurants or have your own spoon fork if you go into an establishment during free it's your own it's pretty sturdy for what it is and it's lightweight would be nice if it came with a knife with it
review.name: Great fork and spoon combinations pretty

review.reviewBody: These are sweet. One of those products I what to buy more of and have many sets just to have. But as a somewhat reasonable person I just bought one. A man can dream....a man can dream.
review.name: Spend your money

review.reviewBody: Although I bought them, maybe 2 years ago, and haven't used them much, I also bought the MSR titanium set at the same time. Nearly identical. MSR was very slightly larger(you'd have to look closely), but noticeably flimsier- thinner and flexed more easily. Fit and finish on the snow peak is clear. The handle portion of this silverware is just a tad shorter than I would like, but the rest of the design is spot on. When looking to eat on the trails, fork and spoon are not easily created. These are hypoallergenic, being titanium, won't melt while near an open camp fire, and incredibly light, like you're not holding anything. The shape and curvature of the scoop of the spoon and prongs of the fork make them useful tools(scraping and stabbing) beyond dining, not that I would suggest that unless in a real pinch. And a definite must have in a go bag. A spork is not good at stabbing nor scooping, better off having a set and with this set, you won't notice any extra weight, if there is any.
review.name: probably best titanium silverware

name: Titanium Fork and Spoon Set

review.reviewBody: I’m 125lbs, full 34C. Small fit the best. One of my favorite tanks. Soft material and I like the high neck line.
review.name: Great Tank

review.reviewBody: Really nice light material that is perfect for outdoor work or a workout. Also love all the color and pattern choices
review.name: Highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: I love the look and feel of this tank. It has sun protection but since it's a tank and doesn't cover my arms or shoulders, that wasn't my top priority. It feels like wearing silk and the camo design is cool--I was hoping this would be my new favorite tank but the fit is odd. I usually wear a Large but the underarm area is too big. I'll likely give this to a friend who is larger than I am
review.name: lightweight but strange fit

review.reviewBody: I am obsessed with the crater lake line of tops. The fabric is buttery smooth, lightweight, cooling, and dries quickly. Hands down my favorite top for any condition.
review.name: Crater Lake for the win

review.reviewBody: It's products like these that make me so wish you could feel things through a screen.  Mountain Hardwear's entire spring line is this way, actually.  This top in particular is just delightful to wear.  It is so, SO lightweight, silky, cooling, and breathable.  I honestly forget I'm wearing anything at all.  It is not restrictive in the slightest and is something I actively enjoy wearing - not a feeling I get very often.  It fits true to size - I'm a L in this and all other MHW tops.  It is a looser fit, but the arm holes don't gape.  I absolutely recommend this top for all your sweaty Summer adventures, and even some lounging, too.
review.name: The most incredible, lightweight fabric

review.reviewBody: I started using this a month ago and the fabric looks terrible - worn and creased, and this is with very light use.
review.name: Great size, poor quality fabric
comment:
Thank you for the feedback. Please note our Thule Aion line has an outer shell fabric, lining, and mesh that are made of 100% recycled polyester from recycled plastic bottles. The recycled nylon waxed 
 canvas will develop a wear / patina look over time as this is normal for this type of material. If you are not satisfied with the product, please reach out to our Customer Service team at the link below:
https://help.thule.com/s/contactsupport?language=en_US

review.reviewBody:
The reason I picked up this small bag was to use for small items and my water bladder for skiing. I get easily dehydrated when I’m on the mountain and if I’m not carrying water around with me I’ll go a whole day without hydrating. This bag fits my 1 liter silicone bladder as well as all the essentials that I need to keep on me (phone, chap stick, credit cards, ID, etc.) nice and compact and easily accessible. I had a small bag before this one that just couldn’t fit everything without the need for removing things. 

A couple features I love are the zipped pockets on the inside that keep important valuables like cash and cards from accidentally slipping out while I get my phone out to take photos. I love that it integrates as a hip strap for the pack pack as well. When I travel, which I do a lot of, I usually only take a back pack. While that’s great for flights it’s not optimal when you’re walking around the city. This feature, of being able to remove this bag from the pack pack helps me stay minimal but not without the essentials I need.
review.name: Perfect size for those quick access items

review.reviewBody: I have used this sling over and over again when traveling.  It is comfortable, and has secure straps.  There is a lot of room for several items.  Love it, and purchased another one for my wife.
review.name: Great sling.

review.reviewBody: I bpught this awhile ago and it has been a good bag
review.name: thule sling bag

review.reviewBody: This product is highly functional, with many subdividers for organization, but it also looks great too. It's slick, sleek, and stylish.
review.name: Slick sling

review.reviewBody:
I've been using it for a couple of weeks and I can say it's a great sling bag - right what I've wanted. It's not baggy and quite flat while wearing. At the same time there is enough space inside to fit a passport, a phone, keys, a small first aid kit, a pair (or even two) of sunglasses, a cardholder, a small pepper spray and maybe smth else. The belt length is easy to change and it's also very comfortable. The only thing is that on me it slides a little bit off the center of the chest, but that's not a problem at all.
The material feels very durable, the inside cloth is very soft and feels great. Pockets are easy to open and it's also good that there are not too many of them. Highly recommend this bag.
review.name: Great sling bag

review.reviewBody: The Aion sling bag is perfect for holding all of the daily items that I carry. Holds my cell, keys and wallet all in one bag that I can easily reach. Even with all those items there is still room for several items. The bag construction and material are durable yet stylish. Thule did not disappoint!
review.name: Exactly the right size

review.reviewBody: I have Aion Carry-on Luggage, Duffle Bag and Sling. Great products. I always get complemented wherever I go. Sling is perfect for my Phone, Wallet and Passport. Highly recommend.
review.name: Aion Duffle and Sling

hasVariant.name: Activeice Sun Sleeve
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Activeice Sun Sleeve online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: To fit my skinny biceps, I had to sew the small/medium smaller at the top. An XS size would be useful for many adults and youth. I bought these with bicycling in mind...be aware that the seam at the end is immediately uncomfortable against the handlebars as it forms a lump right under the index metacarpophalangeal joint. I might end up wearing them on opposite arms, losing the palm grip, or above the thumb. All in all, I should have gone with a different product, but these should do for sun protection. The fabric feels nice and cool, and the top grip strip is comfortable.
review.name: Seams and sizing

review.reviewBody: Super happy with these upon initial try-on. I haven't field tested them but first impressions are good. Very comfortable, I got size S/M, slim arms and they're great, maybe slightly big but they stay up well.
review.name: Instantly felt the cooling affect

review.reviewBody: So I'm 5'11, 165lb and ordered the L/X so they definitely don't compress but that's not what I am looking for. They stay up during runs, really comfortable and made with quality. I have 2 pairs now and will use these often.
review.name: Comfortable and made with Quality

review.reviewBody: I had purchased numerous sleeves till date for my cycling and Outdoor Research is the most comfortable so far. I feel sad for my older sleeves but I just can't bring myself to use them again
review.name: Most comfortable sleeves I had purchased

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of these sun sleeves - I find them very comfortable to wear, very breathable and no itch. I find the t-shirt sun sleeves combo much more comfortable in the heat than a long-sleeved shirt so it's really great in the summer heat. I love being able to keep the sun off my forearms but also the backs of my hands.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Great material, good options for grip and fingers. No sunburn!
review.name: Best Sleeves Ever!

review.reviewBody: I work outdoors a lot and have very fair skin. These sleeves are amazing: the material is very comfortable, even covers the back of your hands, has grip pads so you can still use your hands to work, and they stay up all day long. Even after several washes, they material remains like new. I tell everyone that I work with that they need to invest in a few pairs.
review.name: My summer staple

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The sleeves work well and are easier to carry on runs than a sun hoodie.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, breathable, blocks UV, comfortable. Best of the best
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: As a pasty Ginger, sun protection is a major concern when building a multiday backpacking gear list. I combine the sunsleeves with either the OR sun bucket or the OR Visor depending on the time of year as well as the OR buff. I take the three OR items on every adventure. I am a major fan of OR products. I have a couple items that are almost 30 years old and still in working order. Thank you OR.
review.name: An essential piece of gear for me

name: Activeice Sun Sleeve

review.reviewBody: I have used the Chromapop Spinner (brown lens) for freshwater fly fishing this past year (2023) all over the US. For me, one of the key features is that I'm using this large Smith frame as a 'fit over', worn over my glasses. I cannot purchase prescription sunglasses due to my prescription. In the past, I've been forced to wear low-quality fit over style frames. I've been blown away at the visual acuity these Smith lenses provide, and I can see so much more than ever before under the waters surface. If you are an eyeglass wearer with smaller frames and you're looking for an upgrade, it's well worth trying a pair of these on over your prescription eyewear to see if they fit!
review.name: Used as a fit over

review.reviewBody: These were a Christmas gift and my son loves them !
review.name: These were a Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: Best pair of Smith glasses I’ve owned. Comparable to The Guides Choice. But for my use, better. Light weight, comfortable, form fitting, excellent coverage and visibility. I highly recommend
review.name: Best Smith Sunglass I’ve Owned

review.reviewBody: Love the optics, but the left arm already broke and only use these shades for cycling. Please advise on a replacement.
review.name: Love the optics, but the

review.reviewBody: Lil retro/lil modern but as always great feel and lenses from Smith
review.name: Cool

review.reviewBody: After owning and wearing several top brand sunglasses i would unequivocally say these are the clearest, comfortable eye protection you can buy. The wrap around fit prohibits the sun glare from distorting your view when on the water or driving your car. The Smith warranty is exactly as written, i can attest to this because my stem broke at the hinge after four years of hard wear and Smith replaced them, that simple. I highly recommend Smith eye wear above the other 3 commonly known brands
review.name: After owning and wearing several

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of these sunglasses. Great for fishing!
review.name: Great Pair

review.reviewBody: Logos on both pairs fell off within a day. On both sides. Sent them back and y’all sent a new pair. Same thing did again
review.name: Logos on both pairs fell

review.reviewBody: Love these running the boat, do a great job of blocking the wind & the wrap around style really blocks out the sun.
review.name: Love these running the boat,

review.reviewBody: 10/10. From the wrap around frames, to the seamless chroma pop lenses. These glasses are my new inshore companions. I get zero glare in my peripherals or nose area. I’m so excited and happy with this purchase. It makes spending 10+hrs a day fishing much more enjoyable.
review.name: 10/10. From the wrap around

name: Spinner ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.itemreviewed: Waas ALLIED Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The ad images were haunting me all over instagram and wore me down. The color is a little brighter than in the picture but I kind of like the visibility of it. It is very comfy and a nice in between weight. The features feel well thought out, like nice zippers etc. It’s kind of long but I’ve found I can wear it a little cropped by cinching.
review.name: Super cute, super practical

review.itemreviewed: Waas ALLIED Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Jacket outer material feels pleasant and soft to touch. Nice features with the outer chest pocket and inner pockets. Fit is roomy. 5'5" 128 lb, athletic build, small is a bit roomy with a long sleeve T inside. I didn't try a X-small, prefer to error on the roomier side to fit a thicker base layer under the jacket.
review.name: Soft and warm

review.reviewBody: These ran a bit big, but I chose these because I was looking for something that was a little looser than my usual ski pant fit, and these are great. I was able to cinch them tighter at the waist. I love the many pockets it has, and the insulation kept me nice and warm. Very happy!
review.name: Wonderful

review.reviewBody:
These snow pants are absolutely amazing. True to the size and very stylish. 
Stop looking buy it!
review.name: Nice and warm

review.reviewBody: I purchased the stoic shell pant, which ripped after my first use (where I didn't do any aggressive or fast skiing). I imagine this is the new generation of those pants, with similiar poorly quality fabric.
review.name: Will rip very easily

review.reviewBody: These pants suck. I wore these for a total of 4 times - 2 days the days weren't even full days. Completely ripped down the crotch. These are a Backcountry brand item with a lifetime warranty. However, getting them to honor a warranty claim has been awful - just getting a run around from so many people for over a week. Deleting my account once this is resolved and not shopping with them anymore.
review.name: Ripped after 4 wears

review.reviewBody: Love the pant but it runs large!  Almost two sizes too large. I will try to reorder. The quality is great and I love the style.
review.name: Almost Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in a Small and they were too large so I had to return them. They were also too long for my 29" inseam and 5'1" height. I selected the small based on the size chart that has a 37" hip as a small. I am petite, but I have a rounder behind, and it was still too large. If you are considering ordering these pants, I would suggest sizing down.
review.name: Run large

review.reviewBody: Great quality, may run a little large.
review.name: Superior Quality

review.reviewBody:
These kept me warm in 15 degrees and the cargo-style pockets were so awesome for my ski weekend. Literally carried a whole lunch in them.
The fit was a bit big (I'm usually a size 12 and ordered a large) and the pants sagged around my hips even with the waist synched in. There was a lot of room throughout the pants which I liked for insulation and comfort but I'll need to wear a belt next time.
The biggest downside is that they aren't very durable and ripped in the lower leg after a wipeout. I will continue to use and enjoy them this season but I wouldn't repurchase or pay full price.
review.name: did the job despite fit and rip

review.reviewBody: very nice color and didn’t soak in any snow/water. got some mud on the bottom hems but it easy to clean it off when dry. very nice amount of pockets. didn’t get cold at all
review.name: Incredibly slay

review.reviewBody:
First time buying actual ski pants and I love them! They fit perfect with ski boots. I am 5'4", when I'm not wearing ski boots I do need to roll them up. The material is good quality and the insulation lining feels really nice. I never got cold up on the hill even on the very slow lifts I was warm. I love love love the thigh vents, what a great idea, didn't overheat because of these! 
I got the white pair and they do get dirty easily, but bleach worked well getting my chicken wing stain off.
review.name: Loved these!

name: Insulated Snow Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Got these bad boys in both colors. Not only are my chill vibes through the roof, but sheeeeeesh am I comfy.

Pls release in more colors Kavu. I will buy.
review.name: It’s Giving The Perfect Pant

review.reviewBody: The back pockets are mirrored to the front pockets which made for a peculiar fit. The belt is worthless, teeth don't grasp the nylon webbing.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: I thought I would love these pants like I love Kavu's shorts, the fabric is great, the cut is loose how I like it, and the pockets are big and super useful. Unfortunately the belt makes the pants almost unusable. They decided to use a different material than the belts on the shorts, and this material is much slicker making it impossible to cinch the belt tight. The teeth on the buckle will not grab the smooth fabric and will loosen itself almost instantly, even without tension being put on it. The belt is sewn in and is not removable, and there are no additional belt loops to wear my own belt.
review.name: Nice pants, ruined by belt

review.reviewBody: I have always been a fan of Kavu products, but had never tried these Chilli Roy Pants, essentially a corderoy version of their popular "duck cotton" fabric. As someone still working on post pandemic weight issues -- currently 5'10", edging towards 36" waist, and 180 lbs, the fit on the Large was near perfect in length, adjustable waist, and roomy crotch area. This size should still work as I edge back towards 34"W and 10 fewer pounds. I never have anyone comment on my pants, but have received two compliments about this pair since wearing them. If I had a wish, it would be a bit more lockdown on the built-in Kavu style webbing belt... it gets loose over time. That aside, I would purchase again.
review.name: Cozy and comfortable

name: Chilli Roy Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I ordered these in a size 8 in the green color. The color was a deep dark green. I found the bibs to tight in the stomach and chest. For reference I'm 5-5 140 lbs 38b. I typically wear a size 28 in jeans. I have an older pair of these bibs from when they were s.m.l sized in a medium. The size 8 is much smaller than the old size medium. 

Other than the sizing I liked the material and features, but they are going back.
review.name: They run small

review.reviewBody:
These are an awesome quality bib, I ski in these everyday both in resort and touring. Warm, waterproof, comfortable and cute. 

A note for sizing, these are definitely a looser and baggier fit than the Foxy bib. I am 5 foot 3, 130 pounds, with bigger thighs/butt - I wear a size 4 in the Moxie bib and a size 6 in the Foxy bib.
review.name: My favorite bibs

review.reviewBody: I have seen so many ladies rave about these bibs and I wanted to try them out for this season. Unfortunately, as another reviewer noted, the sizing is NOT for women with a butt and thighs. I am usually between a size 10 and 12 and ordered the 12 and could barely zip them over my thighs. Once I got them zipped they were super tight and I wouldn't have been able to layer much of anything underneath them. For reference, I'm 5'8" and around 180 lbs right now and carry most of my extra weight in my bottom half. Would not recommend these if you carry your weight there because these did not feel TTS at all! I think they would be good for someone with a more straight up and down body type.
review.name: Sizing is off

name: Moxie Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great hat. Perfect for walking, running, and hiking in sunny weather like Las Vegas. Wear it all the time now. Craftsmanship is superb as always. Flap really protects back of the neck. Fit adjustment is excellent.
review.name: Solid Hit

review.reviewBody: This is a great hat!! It is the  ONLY hat that has SPF50+ through the mesh vent! Fit is perfect and the sunglass/eyeglass pockets on sides are awesome! Delivery was right on time.
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody: I haven't used yet - bought for upcoming trip to Botswana. However, it arrived in good time, as listed. Looking forward to using it.
review.name: All right.

review.reviewBody: A true stand-out. I have given away several Sunday hats but this is a keeper. I should buy a second now. Large size needs about 3/4" of tight on the adjustment. Fits loose so I don't get a forehead rub.
review.name: Good Hat, Get One

review.reviewBody: Stunning, perfect fit, I like the neck protector, useful for the sun & wind! Folds & packs away easily. Size adjustable, doesn’t fly off when it’s windy…best sun hat for my hiking activities!
review.name: Superior quality, excellent fit!

review.reviewBody: Love this hat! Keeps me protected from sun's UV and feels cool when wearing.  Love the neck protection so i don't need to wear anything around my neck.
review.name: From top to neck protection

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat in the Quito, Ecuador airport while waiting for a flight to the Galapagos. I have very thick hair, and it’s impossible to find hats in large. It was to wonderful to have the vented hat, the sunglasses lock, and especially the neck protection while spending so much time in the sunny equatorial outdoors. I visited the website to share this review and check out the selection!
review.name: Amazing! Fits Great! Love the Neck Protection!

review.reviewBody: Love this hat. The neck protective piece is awesome.
review.name: Awesome hat

review.reviewBody: well built light weight mtb shoe. i love them they fit perfect and the dual bola makes it easy to tighten on the right places   i am size 13 not to small not too long just right
review.name: great mtb shoe

review.reviewBody:
I struggled with the star rating on these, because at the core, these shoes are really comfortable and that's #1.  I've got pretty medium feet, not especially narrow or wide and my arches are not particularly low or high and oddly I've had trouble finding shoes that fit right.  These Giros nailed the fit though.  The heel holds well, there's plenty of room in the toe box and the midfoot holds my foot just tight enough that I don't need to crank down on the boas to keep my foot in place.  

Now for the negatives--This shoe is heavy, the soles are flexy and they're not particularly breathable.  They're also a bit expensive for a shoe that's heavy, flexy and not particularly breathable.  Don't buy the "carbon-reinforced" line, these are nowhere near as stiff as my previous pair of Giro Codes with their EC70 soles.  

I'm also struggling a bit with the marketing, why do they call this a "gravel" shoe? Its a great XC/Trail (dare I say downcountry?) MTB shoe, where heavy and flexy doesn't really matter, but its when you try to use them on a gravel/road application that their non-racy nature becomes apparent despite their looks.

So anyways, I gave them 4 stars.  If you're not really trying to go fast and it doesn't get particularly hot or humid where you live, these will do you well.  I just don't really think they're a good candidate for an "N-1" setup where you're using a gravelly bike to do both road and gravel though.
review.name: Comfy, but not really race-y

review.reviewBody:
Have owned these for a year now and purchasing a second pair. These shoes are phenomenal and have been used for 7-9 hr gravel rides and long distance road riding. 

Lightweight, durable, and great adjustability with the BOA dials. 

Only downside is that they will not keep your feet warm in colder weather (less than 45F). So if you ride these in cold climates make sure you test fit with thicker socks.
review.name: Superb Gravel Shoe

review.reviewBody:
It took a while and many returns later, I have at long last found a very comfortable and well made MTB shoe!  First off, there are no pressure points on my foot with this shoe.  This, in and of itself, is minor miracle for me.  Just comfort all the way around.  It has a snug fit yet also has some give in the material, making it kind of move with your foot.  The BOA system works well and is 
quick and convenient.  The sole is stiff.  And my heel stays put.  MTB shoes are very individual.  Many seem really not made well, and most have been uncomfortable.  I tried Giro out of desperation, and now I almost want to buy a backup pair.   Comfort and fit is priceless.

Typically I'm a size 11 shoe.  I went with 44.5 here.  I suspect 45 would fit as well.  The 44.5 toe box has juuuust enough room but I like the snug yet comfortable feel so will stick with 44.5.
review.name: FINALLY A supremely comfortable MTB shoe

review.reviewBody: Bought these for gravel riding.  Now that I?ve ridden them a number of times, I?m going to replace my road pedals with SPDs so I can use them for road too.  First, the BOAs.  Superb.   easy on, easy adjusting, easy off.  Careful, its easy to overtighten, but a snap to fix on the fly.  Second, fit.  My old Giros were 44s, so I ordered 44s.  These shoes have a very roomy toe box, they kinda seemed too big at first but they weren?t.  Even with my duck shaped feet my toes have some wiggle room, but the shoes still feel snug enough so they don?t slip.  I will use these for the winter and maybe try some 43.5s for thin sock weather.  That roomy toe box keep feet warm when its cold, too tight means cold feet.  Third, the materials.  Though the uppers seem thin, my feet have been as warm as any shoe I have ridden.  lastly, the look.  These are some beautiful shoes, if shoes can be beautiful.
review.name: Nice shoes
comment: To Jm Ludvk, I'd say probably not a shoe for wider feet.  Though you might try going up a half size.
Question: Do you think this shoe would be suitable for someone needing a slightly wider shoe?

review.reviewBody: I wear Giro road shoes, and I needed new XC MTB shoes.  I was not sure about the fabric construction and some other reviews were very good for this newer shoe.  I have to report, the fit is similar to the GIRO Empire road shoes, with just a little more room in the front.  I wear a Giro 46, and in running shoes I wear an 11.5.  This shoe is very comfortable out of the box, no joke.  I am happy to have made this purchase, and thank you Giro.  You can not go wrong, basic shoe with two BOAs.
review.name: good shoe - no doubts

name: Sector Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: There seems to be ample (down) insulation above the foot in these booties however the sole is only about 1/4-3/8" thick which in my mind doesn't sound like a lot of insulation to be walking around on the snow. There is a gap between the sole foam and the down insulation that i assume will be a cold bridge. these may very well be okay but I'm not field testing them due to the $140 price tag.  I bought Baffin Cush instead for $50 and will field test these.  I typically do 2 night camping trips on the east coast where the temperatures get down to 0degree F while sitting at camp. The search continues...
review.name: Thin Sole - Not properly tested-returned

review.reviewBody: This DD version of the Aggressor tire has been the most difficult to mount and I have mounted many tires over 35 years of riding. These tires are compatible with my Bontrager rims but are hard to mount due to the rim tape. Anyway, after hours of wrestling I got them on the rim only to have them peel off after 6 miles of riding. Fortunately I did`t wreck or damage my carbon rims. The bead must have been slightly damaged during install. Trying to mount them again they would simply pop off the rim during inflation. Now I have a new tire that I cannot use on my Trek Fuel EX and is likely unusable on other rims.
review.name: mounting issues

review.itemreviewed: Amanda II Tall Rain Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this boot in August 2023. After only 15 months of light wear, my boots have developed several cracks. Seems like it is most common in all the areas where the outer boot bends. Wish I could include photos in this review. I have never had a pair of boots crack like these. I have only worn the boots a few times a week around the yard and cleaning my chicken coop. No strenuous tasks that would have caused this amount of damage to a boot. I rinse them off weekly and store them inside my home. They are not exposed to extreme temperatures. I emailed customer service with photos of the boots. I received no response. I would not recommend any Bogs boot made from this material.
review.name: Poor Quality Product

review.itemreviewed: Amanda II Tall Rain Boot - Women's

review.name: Happy wife happy life
